message:
I wanted to have a private git repo, we use github at work, and I saw the private pricing which was 7 usd for 5 private repos
https://github.com/pricing
checked bit bucket and it was similar but by users
https://bitbucket.org/plans/

I found gitlab, they offer a pricey enterprise edition, I expected the free edition to be shitty but I was surprised that it was more than perfect for my needs.
the only issue that it was raping my ram :). but it's still cheaper solution than github/bitbucket as the only cost is the git server you're running

https://about.gitlab.com/

data.message: GitLab takes so much RAM only for the first run. Ba3d keda beyeb2a lateef.
Bit-buket is free for private repos :)
Btw, what does GitLab use the RAM for I'm not sure I understood

well lets see...
this is a t2.micro amazon instance .... 1gb of ram..
Alexandria University dude =D the email service they gave us logs in but never receives anything :'D
